title: Recognize the Standard Equation of Ellipses
text: We recognize this as an ellipse that is centered at the origin. So the equation should be in the form of $$\frac{x^2}{a^2}+\frac{y^2}{b^2}=1$$.
speech: We recognize this as an ellipse that is centered at the origin. So the equation should be in the form of  fraction, x squared, over, a squared,  plus, fraction, y squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1 .

title: Find the Length of Minor Axis
text: The major axis is verticle because the value of the distance from the origin to the horizontal endpoints is less than the distance from the origin to the verticle endpoints. What is the distance from the center of the ellipse (the origin) to the vertex?
speech: The major axis is verticle because the value of the distance from the origin to the horizontal endpoints is less than the distance from the origin to the verticle endpoints. What is the distance from the center of the ellipse (the origin) to the vertex?

title: Find the Length of Major Axis
text: What is the distance from the center of horizontal endpoints of the ellipse?
speech: What is the distance from the center of horizontal endpoints of the ellipse?
pacedSpeech: What is the distance from the center of horizontal endpoints of the ellipse?

title: Plug in Values of a and $$b$$ into Standard Equation
text: Since the verticle distance is $$4$$ which is associated with the coefficient of $$y$$ terms $$b=4$$ and $$b^2=16$$. Since the horizontal distance is $$3$$ which is associated with the coefficient of $$x$$ terms, $$a=3$$ and $$a^2=9$$. Given $$\frac{x^2}{a^2}+\frac{y^2}{b^2}=1$$, through pluging in $$a^2=9$$ and $$b^2=16$$, you should get $$\frac{x^2}{9}+\frac{y^2}{16}=1$$ as your final answer.
